
I’m aware of this issue, and it has to do with cyclic dependencies between the makefile and generated files.

Currently, this is broken:

``` bash
make clean
make
```

However, this works fine, because the dependencies are read before deleting the generated files:

``` bash
make clean all
```

To fix your build, you need to checkout the files you deleted with `make clean`:

``` bash
git checkout src/format/format-localized.js src/time/format-localized.js
make clean all
```
Thanks @mbostock I will apply your workaround.
I fixed it by having smash ignore missing files. Have been meaning to do that for months but thanks to your prodding it is now done.
